Description: Bronze axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge. The sides are bevelled. There are light scratches and tool marks all over, most noticeably on the sides. The cutting edge and its corners are blunted. The blade is only very slightly corroded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to have come from)
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has indicated that after casting the blade was shaped by hammering and grinding and was probably heavily used.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (152)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 May-Oct, Museum of St.Albans, Ancient Egypt
